1.title: Pilot
1.plot: Chandrakanta is born in the kingdom of Vijaygarh to Queen Ratnaprabha. Queen Iravati invades the kingdom and Chandrakanta's destiny turns sour.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Irawati is apprehensive of the Tilimi dagger and its powers that Chandrakanta has received on her 21st birthday. She sends Veer to capture Chandrakanta.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Chandrakanta's parents are blamed for Bhola's death along with her as well and the soldiers complain to Bhupat Singh about it. However, the king of Suryagarh arrives just then and says that no magic has happened and Bhola died because his ship got away from Shivdut's, the king's son, fleet. The king then asks Bhupat Singh to arrange a meeting in the palace so that they can discuss this problem. Meanwhile, Veer is searching for his ring while Chandrakanta has his ring. imdb.plot outline: Young Chandrakanta, the princess of the kingdom of Vijaygarh loses her family and kingdom in a battle waged by the evil Queen Iravati of Naugarh, hungry for ultimate power. Her mother, Queen Ratnaprabha, ensured her daughter's safety before dying with the help of their pet magical dolphin, and the baby ends up with a childless, loving, ordinary Aiyaar couple in the kingdom of Suryagarh, growing up with faint memory of the destruction that had occurred. Unaware of the full extent of her magical powers and her destiny, Chandrakanta grows up to be an exceptionally skilled, beautiful and formidable Aiyaara warrior. The world believes the heir to the Kingdom of Vijaygarh has died and Chandrakanta herself has little knowledge of her true identity. 21 years later, destiny brings Chandrakanta face to face with Prince Veerendra of Naugarh, both unaware of two facts - that they had been betrothed to each other as kids, and that his mother was responsible for the destruction caused to Chandrakanta's life as a child. Meanwhile, Veer not only feels competitive towards her for being a far more skilled warrior than her but also feels attracted to her beauty and spirit.
imdb.title: Chandrakanta
plot: Young _Chandrakanta_ (qv), the princess of the kingdom of Vijaygarh loses her family and kingdom in a battle waged by the evil Queen Iravati of Naugarh, hungry for ultimate power. Her mother, Queen Ratnaprabha, ensured her daughter's safety before dying with the help of their pet magical dolphin, and the baby ends up with a childless, loving, ordinary Aiyaar couple in the kingdom of Suryagarh, growing up with faint memory of the destruction that had occurred. Unaware of the full extent of her magical powers and her destiny, _Chandrakanta_ (qv) grows up to be an exceptionally skilled, beautiful and formidable Aiyaara warrior. The world believes the heir to the Kingdom of Vijaygarh has died and _Chandrakanta_ (qv) herself has little knowledge of her true identity. 21 years later, destiny brings _Chandrakanta_ (qv) face to face with Prince Veerendra of Naugarh, both unaware of two facts - that they had been betrothed to each other as kids, and that his mother was responsible for the destruction caused to _Chandrakanta_ (qv)'s life as a child. Meanwhile, Veer not only feels competitive towards her for being a far more skilled warrior than her but also feels attracted to her beauty and spirit.::none
